questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST mitigates the risk or information loss caused by a cloud service provider becoming insolvent?

choices.A: Contractual provisions for the right to audit

discussion.content: D. The purchasing of cybersecurity insurance
C. Contractual provisions for data repatriation

Selected Answer: C
C. Contractual provisions for data repatriation

comments.content: +1 for AI getting this question right

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Contractual provisions for data repatriation

The best option for mitigating the risk of information loss caused by a cloud service provider becoming insolvent is to have contractual provisions for data repatriation. This means that in the event of the cloud service provider's insolvency or other issues, the contract should include provisions that allow you to retrieve your data and applications from the provider's infrastructure and bring them back in-house or transfer them to another service provider.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the PRIMARY reason to conduct a post-incident review?

discussion.content: C. To improve the response process

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is C. To improve the response process.

A post-incident review, also known as a post-mortem or after-action review, is conducted after an incident or event to assess what happened, identify lessons learned, and improve future incident response. While all the options listed are important considerations after an incident, the primary reason for conducting a post-incident review is to improve the response process.

During a post-incident review, the organization involved in the incident analyzes the incident's causes, response effectiveness, and any gaps or shortcomings in their procedures, systems, or training. By identifying areas for improvement, organizations can make adjustments to their incident response plans, enhance their security measures, and better prepare for future incidents.

Selected Answer: C
C. To improve the response process

choices.D: To aid in future risk assessments
choices.A: To determine whether digital evidence is admissible

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST way to protect against unauthorized access to an encrypted file sent via email?

choices.C: Utilizing a separate distribution channel for the password
choices.B: Using a digital signature in the email
choices.D: Ensuring a policy exists for encrypting files in transit

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Utilizing a separate distribution channel for the password

comments.content: yep, my company does that for password resets, for example. It is sent in in parts via at least 2 communication channels. Depending on the criticality, it can be more than 2.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Utilizing a separate distribution channel for the password means sending the password through a different communication method (e.g., a text message, phone call, or a different email) rather than including it in the same email. This ensures that even if the email is intercepted, the password is not readily available to the unauthorized party, adding an extra layer of security.
